text: Brickellia botterii is a Mexican species of flowering plants in the daisy family. It is native to the state of Veracruz on the coast of the Gulf of Mexico.Turner, B. L. 1997. The Comps of Mexico: A systematic account of the family Asteraceae, vol. 1 – Eupatorieae. Phytologia Memoirs 11: i–iv, 1–272Blake, Sydney Fay 1926. Contributions from the United States National Herbarium 23(5): 1482 description in Latin The species is named for Italian ornithologist Matteo Botteri (1808 – 1877).Robinson, Benjamin Lincoln 1917. Memoirs of the Gray Herbarium of Harvard University 1: 93, figure 72 ==References== botterii Category:Flora of Veracruz Category:Plants described in 1917
title: Brickellia botterii
